title: Galatians Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Galatians chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Galatians Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Galatians Chapter 6.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:1, how should you restore a man overtaken in a fault?
questions.correctAnswer: In the spirit of meekness
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:1 instructs to restore such a one in the spirit of meekness.

questions.question: What are believers encouraged to bear according to Galatians 6:2?
questions.correctAnswer: One another's burdens
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:2 says to bear one another's burdens to fulfill the law of Christ.

questions.question: What does Galatians 6:3 say about a man who thinks himself to be something when he is nothing?
questions.correctAnswer: He deceiveth himself
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:3 states that such a man deceives himself.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:4, what should every man do to have rejoicing in himself alone?
questions.correctAnswer: Prove his own work
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:4 says to prove his own work to rejoice in himself alone.

questions.question: What does Galatians 6:5 say every man shall bear?
questions.correctAnswer: His own burden
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:5 clearly states every man shall bear his own burden.

questions.question: What does Galatians 6:6 say about those taught in the word?
options: They should communicate to their teacher in all good things
They should keep the word to themselves
They should teach others without help
questions.correctAnswer: They should communicate to their teacher in all good things
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:6 instructs those taught to share all good things with their teacher.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:7, what will a man reap?
questions.correctAnswer: Whatsoever he soweth
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:7 states a man will reap what he sows.

questions.question: What is the result of sowing to the flesh according to Galatians 6:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Reap corruption
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:8 says that sowing to the flesh leads to reaping corruption.

questions.question: What encouragement does Galatians 6:9 give about doing good?
options: Do not be weary, for in due season we shall reap
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be weary, for in due season we shall reap
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:9 encourages perseverance in doing good for a future reward.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:10, to whom should we especially do good?
options: Those of the household of faith
questions.correctAnswer: Those of the household of faith
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:10 emphasizes doing good especially to those in the household of faith.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 6:7 warns that God can be mocked without consequence.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:7 states God is not mocked, indicating consequences for mockery.

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 6:15, circumcision is what makes a person acceptable in Christ Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:15 states neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails, but a new creature.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 6:18 ends with a blessing of grace from the Lord Jesus Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:18 concludes with a blessing of grace upon the spirits of the brethren.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Galatians 6:14: 'But God forbid that I should glory, save in the ______ of our Lord Jesus Christ.'
questions.correctAnswer: cross
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:14 says glory is only in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Who does Galatians 6:13 say desires to have you circumcised?
options: Those who desire to glory in your flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Those who desire to glory in your flesh
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:13 explains that those who want you circumcised desire to glory in your flesh.

medium.title: Galatians Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Galatians Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with sin and feels condemned. Based on Galatians 6, how should you restore them?
options: With a spirit of meekness, considering your own vulnerability to temptation
By harshly rebuking them to prevent further sin
Ignoring the fault so as not to offend
Publicly exposing their sin to teach others
questions.correctAnswer: With a spirit of meekness, considering your own vulnerability to temptation
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:1 instructs us to restore a person overtaken in a fault in the spirit of meekness and to consider ourselves to avoid temptation. This encourages gentle restoration rather than harsh judgment.

questions.question: What is the practical way to 'fulfil the law of Christ' according to Galatians 6?
options: By focusing only on personal holiness
questions.correctAnswer: By bearing one another's burdens
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:2 teaches that bearing one another's burdens fulfills the law of Christ, emphasizing mutual care and support as central to Christian living.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6, what happens if a person thinks highly of themselves but actually is nothing?
options: They will be exalted by others
questions.correctAnswer: They deceive themselves
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:3 explains that a person who thinks they are something but is nothing deceives themselves, warning against pride and self-deception.

questions.question: How should a person find joy in their work according to Galatians 6?
options: By proving their own work and rejoicing in themselves alone
By comparing their work to others'
questions.correctAnswer: By proving their own work and rejoicing in themselves alone
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:4 encourages individuals to examine their own work and find joy in it personally rather than comparing with others, fostering contentment and responsibility.

questions.question: What responsibility does every man have regarding burdens, as taught in Galatians 6?
options: To let others carry his burdens
questions.correctAnswer: To bear his own burden
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:5 states that every man shall bear his own burden, emphasizing personal responsibility alongside mutual care.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6, what should one who is taught in the word do for their teacher?
options: Communicate to them in all good things
questions.correctAnswer: Communicate to them in all good things
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:6 instructs those taught in the word to share all good things with their teacher, highlighting generosity and support within the church community.

questions.question: What principle about sowing and reaping does Galatians 6 teach?
options: Whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap
questions.correctAnswer: Whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:7 clearly states that God is not mocked and that a person will reap what they sow, teaching accountability for actions.

questions.question: If someone 'sows to the flesh,' what does Galatians 6 say they will reap?
questions.correctAnswer: Corruption
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:8 contrasts sowing to the flesh, which results in corruption, with sowing to the Spirit, which results in eternal life.

questions.question: What encouragement does Galatians 6 give to those doing good works?
options: Do not be weary in well doing; in due season you will reap if you do not faint
Give up if results are not immediate
Expect no reward for good deeds
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be weary in well doing; in due season you will reap if you do not faint
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:9 encourages perseverance in good works with the promise of a future reward if one does not give up.

questions.question: Who should we especially do good unto, according to Galatians 6?
options: Those who are of the household of faith
questions.correctAnswer: Those who are of the household of faith
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:10 urges believers to do good to all men, but especially to fellow believers, emphasizing care within the Christian community.

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 6, some insist on circumcision to avoid suffering for the cross of Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:12 states that certain people compel others to be circumcised so they won’t suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.

questions.question: True or False: In Galatians 6, Paul says that circumcision is what truly makes a person a new creature in Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:15 declares that neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything but being a new creature in Christ is what truly matters.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul says he will glory only in the _______ of our Lord Jesus Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: cross
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:14 states Paul will glory only in the cross of Jesus Christ, emphasizing the centrality of Christ's sacrifice.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6, what accompanies those who walk by the rule of being a new creature?
questions.correctAnswer: Peace and mercy
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:16 blesses those who walk by this rule with peace and mercy, highlighting the spiritual blessings of faithful living.

questions.question: What does Paul say he bears in his body as a mark of his faith, according to Galatians 6?
options: The marks of the Lord Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The marks of the Lord Jesus
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:17 reveals Paul bears the marks of the Lord Jesus in his body, signifying his suffering and commitment to Christ.

hard.title: Galatians Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Galatians Chapter 6.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:1, how should those who are spiritual restore a brother overtaken in a fault?
questions.correctAnswer: In the spirit of meekness
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:1 instructs spiritual people to restore someone caught in a fault gently and humbly, to avoid temptation themselves.

questions.question: Galatians 6:2 states that bearing one another's burdens fulfills which law?
questions.correctAnswer: The law of Christ
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly says that bearing one another's burdens fulfills the law of Christ, highlighting the ethical demand of love taught by Jesus.

questions.question: What warning is given in Galatians 6:3 about self-perception?
options: If a man thinks he is something when he is nothing, he deceives himself
If a man thinks he is nothing, he is truly wise
If a man thinks highly of others, he will be exalted
If a man thinks he is weak, he is strong
questions.correctAnswer: If a man thinks he is something when he is nothing, he deceives himself
questions.explanation: This verse warns against pride and self-deception, emphasizing humility as a virtue in Christian conduct.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Galatians 6:4: 'But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in _____.'
questions.correctAnswer: another
questions.explanation: The verse encourages personal responsibility and rejoicing in one's own work, not comparing or boasting in others.

questions.question: How does Galatians 6:5 describe the responsibility of each person?
options: Every man shall bear his own burden
Every man shall bear his neighbor's burden
Every man shall be judged by others
Every man shall seek help from the community
questions.correctAnswer: Every man shall bear his own burden
questions.explanation: This verse balances communal responsibility with personal accountability, indicating each must carry their own load.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:6, what should the one taught in the word do for the one who teaches?
options: Communicate unto him in all good things
questions.correctAnswer: Communicate unto him in all good things
questions.explanation: The text commands that those who receive teaching should share good things with their teachers, reflecting reciprocity and care.

questions.question: What principle does Galatians 6:7 convey with the imagery of sowing and reaping?
options: God is not mocked: one reaps what one sows
Sowing seeds guarantees a harvest of wealth
Sowing only affects others, not oneself
questions.correctAnswer: God is not mocked: one reaps what one sows
questions.explanation: This verse uses agricultural metaphor to teach that actions have consequences, and God ensures justice.

questions.question: Galatians 6:8 contrasts sowing to the flesh with sowing to the Spirit. What is the outcome of sowing to the Spirit?
questions.correctAnswer: Life everlasting
questions.explanation: Sowing to the Spirit results in eternal life, as opposed to corruption from sowing to the flesh.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 6:9 encourages believers to not grow weary in well doing because they will reap in due season if they do not faint.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly exhorts perseverance in doing good with the promise of a future harvest.

questions.question: Who does Galatians 6:10 especially urge believers to do good unto?
options: Them who are of the household of faith
questions.correctAnswer: Them who are of the household of faith
questions.explanation: While good should be done to all, there is special emphasis on those within the Christian community.

questions.question: What is significant about the letter Paul mentions in Galatians 6:11?
options: It is large and written with his own hand
questions.correctAnswer: It is large and written with his own hand
questions.explanation: Paul notes the large letters to emphasize the personal and serious nature of his message in the letter.

questions.question: What motivation do some have for compelling circumcision according to Galatians 6:12?
options: To avoid persecution for the cross of Christ
To keep the Mosaic law perfectly
To become more righteous before God
questions.correctAnswer: To avoid persecution for the cross of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul reveals that those insisting on circumcision do so to escape suffering associated with following Christ.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:14, in what does Paul glory?
options: In the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: In the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul rejects boasting in human achievements and boasts only in the redemptive work of Christ's cross.

questions.question: Galatians 6:15 states that neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but what does?
questions.correctAnswer: A new creature
questions.explanation: This highlights the transformative power of faith in Christ over external religious rites.

questions.question: Who does Paul bless with peace and mercy in Galatians 6:16?
options: Those who walk according to the new rule and the Israel of God
questions.correctAnswer: Those who walk according to the new rule and the Israel of God
questions.explanation: Paul refers to the spiritual Israel, those following Christ's rule, bestowing peace and mercy.

theological.title: Galatians Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Galatians Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:1, how should a spiritual person restore someone overtaken in a fault?
questions.correctAnswer: In the spirit of meekness
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:1 instructs that spiritual believers should restore those caught in sin with gentleness and humility, considering their own vulnerability to temptation. This aligns with teachings in James 5:19-20, Luke 6:36, Matthew 18:15-17, and 2 Timothy 2:24-25.

questions.question: What does Galatians 6:2 say is fulfilled when believers bear one another's burdens?
questions.correctAnswer: The law of Christ
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:2 states that by bearing each other's burdens, believers fulfill the law of Christ, which emphasizes love and mutual care. Similarly, John 13:34-35, Romans 13:8-10, and Matthew 22:37-40 highlight love as the fulfillment of God's law.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give in Galatians 6:3 regarding self-perception?
options: If a man thinks himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceives himself
If a man thinks little of himself, he is humble
If a man thinks himself perfect, he is wise
If a man thinks himself weak, he is strong
questions.correctAnswer: If a man thinks himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceives himself
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:3 warns against pride and self-deception, emphasizing humility. This aligns with Proverbs 16:18, 1 Corinthians 8:2, Romans 12:3, and James 4:6, which caution against arrogance and promote sober self-assessment.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:4, on what basis should a person find rejoicing?
questions.correctAnswer: In his own work alone
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:4 encourages believers to examine their own labor and rejoice in their personal efforts rather than comparing themselves to others, reflecting principles found in 2 Corinthians 10:12, Ecclesiastes 4:4, Philippians 2:14-16, and Romans 14:12.

questions.question: What responsibility does Galatians 6:5 attribute to every man?
questions.correctAnswer: To bear his own burden
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:5 teaches personal responsibility in carrying one's own load, balancing communal support with individual accountability, as echoed in Romans 14:12, 1 Corinthians 9:27, Proverbs 22:6, and Matthew 11:28-30.

questions.question: What does Galatians 6:6 instruct about those taught in the word?
options: They should share all good things with their teachers
They should keep the teaching to themselves
They should only learn without contributing
questions.correctAnswer: They should share all good things with their teachers
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:6 commands that those instructed in Scripture ought to provide for their teachers materially or otherwise, consistent with 1 Timothy 5:17-18, Luke 10:7, Deuteronomy 25:4, and 1 Corinthians 9:14 which affirm support for ministers of the gospel.

questions.question: What principle about sowing and reaping does Galatians 6:7 emphasize?
options: God is not mocked; a man reaps what he sows
Only good sowing yields a harvest
Reaping depends on human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: God is not mocked; a man reaps what he sows
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:7 declares the immutable divine principle that one's actions determine their outcomes, echoing Proverbs 22:8, Hosea 8:7, 2 Corinthians 9:6, and Job 4:8 on divine justice and consequences.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:8, what is the outcome for those who sow to the flesh versus those who sow to the Spirit?
options: Sowing to the flesh leads to corruption; sowing to the Spirit leads to everlasting life
Sowing to the Spirit leads to corruption; sowing to the flesh leads to life
Both sowing to the flesh and Spirit lead to the same outcome
Sowing to the flesh produces eternal life
questions.correctAnswer: Sowing to the flesh leads to corruption; sowing to the Spirit leads to everlasting life
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:8 contrasts the results of living according to sinful desires versus living by the Spirit, consistent with Romans 8:5-13, John 3:6, Proverbs 11:18, and Matthew 6:19-21.

questions.question: What encouragement does Galatians 6:9 give to those doing good?
options: Do not grow weary, for in due season you will reap if you do not give up
Give up when you feel tired
Only some will reap the harvest
questions.correctAnswer: Do not grow weary, for in due season you will reap if you do not give up
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:9 encourages perseverance in good works with the promise of eventual reward, paralleling 2 Thessalonians 3:13, Hebrews 12:1-3, James 5:7-8, and Psalm 126:5-6.

questions.question: Who does Galatians 6:10 specifically emphasize we should do good unto?
options: Especially to them who are of the household of faith
Only to those who can repay
questions.correctAnswer: Especially to them who are of the household of faith
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:10 prioritizes doing good to fellow believers, reflecting the biblical principle of mutual care found in 1 Timothy 5:8, Hebrews 13:16, Acts 2:44-45, and Romans 12:13.

questions.question: In Galatians 6:12, why do some compel circumcision according to Paul?
options: To avoid persecution for the cross of Christ
To obey the Old Testament law
questions.correctAnswer: To avoid persecution for the cross of Christ
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:12 reveals that certain individuals pressured circumcision to avoid suffering for Christ’s cross, highlighting human tendencies to seek approval rather than genuine faith, as also seen in Acts 15:1-2, Philippians 3:18-19, 2 Timothy 3:12, and John 15:20.

questions.question: What does Paul say about circumcision and uncircumcision in Galatians 6:15?
options: Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails; but being a new creature
Both are equally important for righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails; but being a new creature
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:15 emphasizes that external rituals like circumcision do not determine a believer's standing; rather, transformation into a new creation in Christ is essential, consistent with 2 Corinthians 5:17, Romans 2:29, Colossians 3:9-10, and Ezekiel 36:26-27.

questions.question: What blessing does Paul pronounce on those who walk according to the new creature rule in Galatians 6:16?
questions.correctAnswer: Peace and mercy
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:16 pronounces peace and mercy upon those who live by the new creation principle, reflecting Jesus’ teachings in John 14:27, Romans 12:18, Hebrews 4:16, and Psalm 85:10.

questions.question: What does Paul claim to bear in his body according to Galatians 6:17?
options: The marks of the Lord Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The marks of the Lord Jesus
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:17 states that Paul bears in his body the marks of Jesus, indicating his suffering for Christ’s sake, in line with Colossians 1:24, 2 Corinthians 4:10, Acts 9:16, and Philippians 3:10.

questions.question: In Galatians 6:14, what does Paul say he will glory in?
options: The cross of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The cross of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Galatians 6:14 states Paul’s pride is solely in Christ’s cross, symbolizing the believer’s union with Jesus and separation from worldly values, supported by Philippians 3:8, Romans 6:6, 1 Corinthians 1:18, and Isaiah 53:5.
